pageContext.claim: “It maintains Medicaid coverage for every single elderly American, disabled American, and American child who is currently on the program.”
pageContext.analysis: "Currently" is the key word here. Like all health insurance markets, Medicaid is constantly churning enrollees. So people on Medicaid by the time the BCRA takes effect would not be the same population of people who are “currently” on Medicaid. Some people may leave Medicaid if, for example, they had access to employer health insurance. They may not be able to get back on Medicaid if they sought to later, if the eligibility changes.
